review.reviewBody: Comfort, fit, looks, are all tops. I bought a different brand previously and was so jaded that I didn't want to buy these. I am glad I did, now I want a few more pairs of these, very good socks.
review.name: I love these socks

review.reviewBody: These socks are solid. I cycle 7,000+ miles a year and wear these all the time. No blisters, hotspots and I have used these for 112 mile without issue. Did I mention they are made in the USA?!
review.name: Could this be the greatest cycling sock?

review.reviewBody: I've worn swiftwick for over 10 years now, I wear them for casual use too and believe they are the best socks on the planet.  Tight, compressive and comfy plus they wick mositure.  Fantastic!
review.name: Love Swiftwick

review.reviewBody:
Pro's
1. Swiftwick style names makes it easy to know exactly what you are getting. The four in the name means it is a 4" height sock. No guessing or surprises on what a "mid calf" length sock is so I really appreciate it and wish every brand would do this.
2. These are the best non-merino wool socks I've tried. No more 6 pack socks for me, these really are great.
3. The top section really hugs your leg, you don't have to pull them up once you put them on.

Con
1. Seems to attract hair and debris easily, but not enough to not give it 5 stars


4" length socks are perfect, wish there were more options. Not too short and not too long, but still gives you the look and protection you want. 

Highly recommend
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable, medium-weight socks. Fit true to size. Hug the foot nicely around the arch and the ankle. Seams are well-placed so I can never imagine you'd get a blister with these. Well worth the price.
review.name: Great socks!

review.reviewBody: i think it takes a cyclist or even runner, a bit to figure out how important socks are. Don't mess around with cheap crap. Swiftwick makes some of THE best out there. the aspire might be my favorite, the four is my favorite length.
review.name: some of the best

review.reviewBody: Gave the blue version a try after reading the many positive reviews and was not disappointed. Fit is perfect. Feels great on the feet, even after a long ride in 60 degree temps. Quality seems top-notch. Made in the good ol' US of A. The best pair of cycling socks purchased in 27+ years!
review.name: Best Cycling Socks Ever Purchased!

review.reviewBody: Fits great, feels great, it's just great! No chaffing compared to the various other socks I've had. Their guarantee is one of the few corporate promises that held up their end of the bargain.
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: Tried a few brands and Swiftwick is hands down the best fit I've found (at least for a woman). They're snug and stay up but don't cut off circulation. No bunching. Loved these so much that I just bought a bunch of the Pursuit version for winter riding in Boston. Thanks for making these great socks swiftwick!
review.name: Best Socks!

review.reviewBody: These socks are obviously very pricey, but I love them. Favorite riding socks to be honest. I don't know if they're "worth the price," but they're noticably better than the other three socks I have (priced at: 4$,6$,9$).
review.name: Expensive but super enjoyable

name: Aspire Quarter Crew High Sock

review.reviewBody: My son was so thrilled that I found these shorts in the length he needed. The shorts fit great and the waist is adjustable, so no belt needed! The material is comfortable and easy-care- no ironing needed.
review.name: Perfect length shorts for my tall son!

review.reviewBody: I have countless stretch Zion pants and shorts and it was nice to find some at a better price then anywhere else.
review.name: Best Shorts Ever Made!

review.reviewBody: These are good shorts that fit me well. I may be in the minority, but the new button design doesn’t bother me.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Cheap thin fabric, ugly reflective colors, and the plastic button downgrade.  It’s official: version two sucks. Used to wear the Zion daily, no longer.
review.name: Awful

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought multiple pairs of these for my husband and so , they both love the. They love the comfort and all the pockets.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Prana, what were you thinking!? The original Stretch Zion line was already perfect. Why did you take a great selling and well loved line and change it, and especially cheapen it. Bring back the OG Zions, or else!
review.name: If it Ain't Broke, Don't fix it!

review.reviewBody: I have the exact same shorts from several years ago (Zion 28X10) and they fit perfect. These - they feel different, they are smaller, tighter, and the button is a bit strange to button. Sadly will return, as they aren't what I know and love and just not comfortable.
review.name: The changes weren't for the better

review.reviewBody: Like everyone else has said material now seems cheaper and the button change was a bad idea.. have 11 other prana shorts/pants and the new design and change seems cheap and disappointing..
review.name: Read below…

review.reviewBody: I hope Prana reads this.  I have 15 pairs of prana pants and shorts and love them all.  Just got these shorts with this new plastic button and I hate them.  Very disappointing that Prana took something that was so good and ruined it.  Yes it is so bad that if they don't go back to the original button I will never buy Prana again.
review.name: Will never buy Prana with  new button

review.reviewBody: Button pinches whenever I sit down. Cannot get them to fit comfortably. Material has pilled and just feels pretty cheap. Disappointing for expensive shorts, especially as the first version was so good.
review.name: Terrible button

review.itemreviewed: Genesis GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I've run technical trails and snowy pavement in Minnesota for years on Speedcross GTX. Tried the Genesis for the promise of a bit more stability and pronation control. 
This shoe is much, much wider than Speedcross has been. Hopefully Salomon isn't going for that "American fit" and the Speedcross 6, which I'll order once my return goes through, won't also be this wide.
review.name: Beautiful shoe but way too wide

review.reviewBody: If you are accustomed to the features and style of other pants / base layers from HH, these are a step up from some offerings. Warm, lightweight and pleased with their durability thus far.

review.reviewBody: The Lifa Merino hoody tops are fantastic.  Expecting similar quality and fit from the pants but disappointed. I wear merino wool pants steelhead fishing in the winter.  Major omission was a fly.  Every other merino wool baselayer pant I own from other manufacturers has a fly, but not the HH.  Also the pant was too large..even for my extra long legs.  Better than too short I guess.  These will be last in line behind other brands.

review.reviewBody: I like these, good color, good length for tall people, and I enjoy that the straps are detachable
review.name: Good pants

review.reviewBody: These are my go to touring pants for literally every condition. Unbelievable honestly. I use them all winter in the Wasatch, every single day I tour I am wearing these pants. I wear them in sunshine, in pow, in precipitation. Leg ventilation gives them even more temperature range. They are so comfortable. They fit like a breeze over my boots. They are bomber. I’m five years into wearing them and they really aren’t showing much wear at all.
review.name: Best Touring Pants with impressive range

review.reviewBody: I’m in search and rescue and bought these for backcountry winter use. They fit great (5’6” and 153). I have a K9 which means I’m moving around a lot, not just upright for skiing. They allow me to flex, have a good side vent at the hip/thigh and decent pockets.
review.name: Comfortable soft shell pants

review.reviewBody: Pants look flattering but not sure the button came off on 2nd wear! Not very sustainable for the price.
review.name: Nice design but poor quality

review.reviewBody: Used these bad babies to get through the deep snow of Austria while XC skiing. It was super stretchy and water proof. Great pair of pants
review.name: Fantastic XC skiing pants

review.reviewBody: Zipper on beacon pocket blew after 10 uses - no repair available. All of the zippers are low quality. I had these pants for less than a year and the zipper blew during beacon practice at the start of the season. Warranty consideration would require I mail them to the United States and go without my touring pants for months (the whole season) with no repair plan and no comparable replacement option and no guarantee of repair. Local gear repair shop noted the pocket desing makes replacing the zipper very difficult if even possible.
review.name: low quality zippers-do not buy

review.reviewBody: These are so comfy. I could literally do the splits in them.
review.name: Best touring pants

review.reviewBody: They're very comfortable and they keep me warm and dry skiing in wet snow storms

review.reviewBody: I've worn ExOffcio undies for years and never experienced this type of UNCOMFORT - I do not like my undies riding up my backside.  No Wedgies for me.  I donated them to charity.
review.name: If You Like a Good Wedgie These Are For

review.reviewBody: Uhm….how have i never tried these??? These might be the most perfect underwear if not actually perfect!! Stays in place, extremely light weight,  breathable, drys quickly and durable! Only way they could be better ia if they were cheaper. Ive done compression liners merino wool and many others. Nothing compares!
review.name: Underwear heaven?

review.reviewBody:
Like, totally average, at a higher than average cost.

They were proposed to me by multiple people I consider experts on the best gear...

And my own experience? Meh.
Just underwear.

(Compared to, for example, Smartwool - THOSE I actually see the reason to pay extra - Ex Officio - not so much. And maybe I'm missing something obvious.)
review.name: I guess I don't get it?

review.reviewBody: I first bought 2 pairs of these in 2015 for a 6 month backpacking trip. Came back and was the newest diehard fan. 5 years of continuous use week after week, adding several more to my lineup, and I'm loving them more than ever. Fantastic build quality, comfort is unparalleled, and the consistency of design over the years has me trusting in this brand over any other i've tried, hands down.
review.name: 5 years later and still loyal!

review.reviewBody: I wish I had read reviews before buying (these are the only underwear I have used for the last 10 years, so why would I?).  I agree with what others have written: the material feels cheaper and is more flimsy, they ride up much easier, and the tag on the inside is excessively long and annoying.  Ex Officio - please bring back the high quality product you used to make!
review.name: cheaper than they used to be
comment: I too am unhappy with the changes to this once great product. The material feels cheaper and the fit is off. Too bad.

review.reviewBody: Fits OK and prevents rash on hot or hiking days BUT way too expensive.
review.name: U Wear

review.reviewBody: I was disappointed by another brand who said they had the best men’s underwear. All they had was a higher price. I can honestly say the give and go boxer is the best pair of men’s underwear!  these will be the only underwear I buy from now on. Thanks!
review.name: Best pair of undies....

review.reviewBody: Great for everyday wear or for a trek across Portugal and Spain... but, I took three pairs, just in case:)
review.name: Great for every day or a trek

review.reviewBody: These things are indestructible. Full disclosure: my husband has several pairs that are 8 years old without any holes, stains, fading, or over-stretching.
review.name: Worth the price

review.reviewBody: I have been weraing these foor years.  No crotch cutting, nice materia, no skimpy - very comfortable.
review.name: great for women too

hasVariant.name: Pro Road Bike Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Evoc Pro Road Bike Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Purchased an EVOC Travel Bike Box. The item was extremely difficult to put together and I couldn't get the "stays" to go in the channels to make the box rigid. I even took the Box up to the Park City headquarters and retail store to get help - the retail clerk said there was no one in the store to help me get the "stay" in. No attempt to help, despite there were several people in store standing around. I then took it to some of my bike friends and a bike shop, to try to get the stay inside. No avail. Called today to get a refund on the defective product and they said the best the could do was an instore credit. Despite that it is defective, despite the attempt to get someone from Backcountry to help, despite that no bike shop could get it to go in. It is "used" because I put it together and then brought it to Park City in my car, to get help and wheeled it on the sidewalk, took it to a bike shop and friends to try to fix. I requested a full refund to my card vs. store credit to buy another product from Backcountry because the experience was so horrible. It was denied by Ben in customer service and his manager. I was warned about Backcountry and they lived up to their reputation. Buyer beware, deal directly with manufacturers. Backcountry is not interested in servicing their customers - they deal in volume. Pay attention to the reviews that state the return/exchange with Backcountry is problematic. My other bike box is a Scion and never had an issue with it. Ben in customer service encouraged me to post my review online.
review.name: Backcountry - you can do better

review.reviewBody: Best bag to travel with! Durable ! Easy to travel with light and rolls great. The hard case gives you peace of mind that your bike will arrive in one piece. Well worth the money/investment
review.name: Best travel bike bag

review.reviewBody:
The bag did it's job and protected the bike during my trip, I enjoyed the minimum disassembly require to travel. However I had two of the issues with the bag. First, one of the rivets on the side walls fell off right at unpacking, this didn't seem to affect the bag structure but it was concerning none the less. Next, the aluminum rails have plastic end caps that keep falling off and I need to glue them or find a way to keep them on. At this price point these minor problems should not be there. 

Things to consider for this bag: 
- The bag is really big and bulky, will it fit in your vehicle or rental you will be using?
- Weight wise, the bag is heavy and may only carry your bike but no other items (bags or tools)
- Instruction book looks nice but it is difficult to read in low light setting or to understand due to minimal write ups. No instructional videos by EVOC.
review.name: Bike protected but bag QA

name: Pro Road Bike Bag

description: Buy the Thule Vital 8L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vital 8L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Vital 8L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The construction and fit of this bag is excellent! My only complaint Relates to the Hydro-Pack, as it’s retained a noticeable plastic taste through its early life. This is a problem with virtually all packs on the market though, hence why I’m still very happy with the product.
review.name: Great, large & secure pack.

review.reviewBody: This is hands down the best hydration pack I've used.  I've been using this pack for 2 years and it remains my go to pack while others collect dust. It's thoughtfully designed for the needs of mountain biking   The pack sits lower to distribute the load over the hips (vs. up high on the shoulders) which reduces fatigue on long rides. The expandable cargo capacity combined with the 2.5L reservoir makes this pack extremely versatile for shorter rides to full day efforts. The ReTract hose system works flawlessly for staying hydrated while keeping the hose secure and out of the way. Easy access side pockets makes reaching for food or gear a breeze while riding. Various internal pockets for organizing and securing gear. The materials are durable and allow for good ventilation. This pack is holding up well and I'm looking forward many more miles. Highly recommended!
review.name: Best hydration pack I've ever had

review.reviewBody: Love how it feels & it's easy to adjust straps. Holds a lot of water and the hose design is great. Highly recommend.
review.name: Much improved over my camelbak

review.reviewBody: I had the opportunity to use this Thule product on a multi day Colorado Trail adventure ride.  It was a great tool.  I don't normally like hydration packs, but it is necessary on 4 8 hour rides.  The product has been designed to sit lower on your back making it more comfortable and ergonomic.  The pack also breathes better than most packs I have tried.  There are two other features that are really awesome:  1. The easy access side pockets that you can easily reach when riding.  This is great when you are grabbing a snack or your phone to snap a quick pic. 2. The magnetic hydration valve/tube is easy to grab and also snaps back into place with ease.  This pack is great for a longer endurance ride!
review.name: Thule Vital 6L on 4 8 hour multi day Colorado Trail Ride

name: Vital 8L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent backpack. Adjustable for comfort. This is a great option for short and long hikes/camping.
review.name: Excellent backpack. Adjustable for comfort.

review.reviewBody: Superb quality everywhere and durable. Superb comfort. A few nip picking things I may do different is add an umbrella holder on the shoulder straps with molle webbing that I have seen done and is quite neat. Also the stow and go trek pole holders. Also I noticed the lid on top has 4 little molle like webbing straps and that is it. It would be much better if there was 2 more in the middle and all 4 were horizontal? and not diagonal? so you can attach a shock cord or straps to hold a blanket, rain coat or etc. As they are now you can't really do much with them especially with only 4 spaced so far apart and facing diagonally. But not a big deal and not worth a point deduction as this pack is exactly what I needed since I am almost 60 and it is so comfortable and adjustable and just hugs the body with nice air ventilation also. Once you load it right and adjust it accordingly is when you really notice this compared to a cheaper pack that just breaks you down and wets your clothes in sweat. I will never buy a cheap pack again as it is better for me to go to a premium one like this Osprey and spend a little extra for one that is made the way it should be to achieve the comfort, adjustability, and durability level needed to enjoy ones self when out and about other wise I would just be miserable and broke down with a bad back and knees. Trust me at my age its should be easy to understand.
review.name: I would buy fifty of these if I needed fifty. No hesitation

name: Atmos AG LT 50L Pack

review.reviewBody: I've used this solely for outdoor rock climbing so far.  It's been amazing.  The helmet is extremely breathable.  It manages to stay on your head while your shifting it around, due to the highly adjustable fit.  Numerous people have used it, and its been well liked due the the adjustability.  I have used it in cold and rainy weather, and it fits seamlessly into my Mammut Eiger Extreme shell. Overall a great helmet for getting into climbing.
review.name: Lightweight Helmet

review.reviewBody:
The helmet itself fits me just fine---But the Chin Strap is Way Too Short!
It fits unless I want to wear a beanie or cap underneath for cold weather--which is an absolute must in my case. No way I can get the beanie or cap under and still snap the chin strap.
I have adjusted all the slack out of the strap system that I can but Way Too Tight on Throat.
What to do? I looked at Mammut's support page but there is no help there. And no phone number to call.
review.name: Chin strap is Way Too Short

review.reviewBody: I've purchased many helmets for climbing/scrambling, and this is by far my favorite. It is lightweight enough that I barely notice it on my head or attached to my pack, it's extremely comfortable, and it fits over a hat if I want to wear one. I also like the low-fuss adjustments of the soft nylon straps in the back, which other helmets that I've tried often make out of hard plastic, which can be uncomfortable. It fits snug, and though I (thankfully) haven't had to test its performance in a fall/during rockfall, I have no doubt it will do its job. I was a little worried about the durability of the exposed foam, but after carrying it through a heavy hailstorm and generally banging it around in the back of the car or on whatever summit I take it off on, I can't spot a single dent.
review.name: Best I've Tried

review.reviewBody:
Lightweight enough that I often forget that I have it on -- but has been sturdy enough that I have no worries about it getting dinged up while strapped to the back of whatever pack I have for the approach. 

The harness system is fairly minimalistic. Personally, I love it -- but if you are more accustomed to something like the Borea or Half Dome it may take some getting used to. 

Would love some more options on colours -- but that is just silly details.
review.name: Solid helmet for alpine days

review.reviewBody: I've used this helmet for a couple of weekend climbs recently that were long and hot. Lightweight, comfortable and excellent ventilation made for a great experience.
review.name: A great helmet

review.reviewBody: This is a super lightweight helmet that still manages to be comfortable. I have owned several helmets over the years but I think this one is my favorite. My wife has one too and she also loves it. I would highly recommend this helmet to anyone counting grams for fast and light missions. This helmet is also easy to use, making it great for beginners and experts alike. And the ventilation holes help keep you cool when the sun is beating down. You should just go ahead and buy it!
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: Great light weight helmet. The lip on front helps keep rain and snow melt off your face.

I haven't worn a more comfortable helmet. From summer sport cragging to ice climbing and mountaineering, this helmet does it all. I forget I'm wearing it, that's how comfortable it is! It fits my head perfectly, and it just happens to be my favorite color combo :)
review.name: The most comfortable fit

review.reviewBody: comfortable,easy to adjust and confidence inspiring. This helmet has been great in all climbing situations from spirt cragging to trad multipitch
Light, comfortable, good colour choices. Will continue to buy!
review.name: Does the job!

name: Wall Rider Climbing Helmet

review.reviewBody: Got two bourbon cokor pages for my matte black Cervelo Caledonia 5. Such a beautiful contrast. They hold my water bottles with bo issues. review.reviewBody: The cage itself was nicely designed, nicely built and very light. But the anodizing was really bad...unacceptable. It looks like it wasn't properly anodized so the anodizing didn't adhere. Maybe it was just a bad cage or bad batch, but this one's going back. It matches my grips nicely and I'd like to get another one in the purple color, but it may be hard to get the Competitive Cyclist crew to pick one out for me that doesn't have anodizing problems, and I don't want to keep sending them back. Still, I might try to get them to do this for me.
review.name: Really bad anodizing but otherwise good

review.reviewBody:
Hard to fault Osprey bags. This is the third, and my previous two lasted more than 10 years each. And that is 10 years of almost daily use - packing for work, the gym, weekends away etc.
Worth paying that bit extra for something that really lasts.
review.name: Brilliant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this pack as a gift for my son. He had been borrowing my favorite pack and the only way he was going to give it back was if he had one of his own. Both of us are big fans of the quality, functionality and versatility of the Talon packs. (I have all 4 in the series).
review.name: I bought this pack as

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently used the Osprey Talon 44 for a one-day hike up Mt. Fuji, and I couldn’t be more impressed. This backpack is incredibly sturdy and handled a few falls without any damage. I was especially pleased with the mesh back panel, which, while still warm, was definitely cooler than typical backpacks, offering noticeable improvement in ventilation.

The Talon 44 accommodates a 3L water reservoir perfectly, which was a game-changer for staying hydrated during the hike. I also opted for the medium-sized rain cover, and it fit flawlessly. One of the standout features is the safety whistle integrated into the chest buckle—an excellent touch for added security.

Adjustability is another strong suit of this pack. I was able to tailor the fit precisely to my frame, which is 5'10" and 170 pounds, ensuring comfort throughout the 10-hour hike. With a load of roughly 20-25 pounds, I experienced zero back pain, highlighting the backpack’s impressive support and ergonomic design.

Overall, the Osprey Talon 44 exceeded my expectations in every way, and I would highly recommend it to anyone in need of a reliable, well-designed daypack.
review.name: I recently used the Osprey

review.reviewBody:
I used this one for several months and it's a pretty good pack when on discount, but after careful consideration I switched to Stratos 44 and here's why
1) Too lightweight. They stripped too much and compared to Stratos, both shoulder pads and waist pads are very slim, much less comfortable with heavier loads.
2) Has no water proofing by itself and also no integrated rain cover.
3) Side compression straps don't feature fastex locks, which means you can't fully unstrap them. Makes it a pain to fit something large (for example, it you already used bottom straps for a tent and want to attach sleeping pad to the side)
4) Mesh pocket on the back goes loose very fast
5) Bottom is not very durable, starts to wear out quite easily
6) Waist pockets are designed in a way that you can't comfortably open and close them using only one hand

Overall, it is a pretty good pack and it does it's job pretty well, but the aforementioned issues made me switch to Stratos. One the bright side, Talon seems to be more spacious (lid straps allow you to put some overhead head between the main compartment and the lid, stratos has the lid sewn in) and also 0.8lbs lighter.
review.name: Good pack, but I went for Stratos after

review.reviewBody: Looked at a lot of packs between 35-45 liters and this was the perfect bag. Highly functional in every way, while still comfortable and lightweight. Perfect weekend backpack!
review.name: The perfect pack for lightweight weekend missions

review.reviewBody: Pad too thin for mountain Biking or Gravel.  Why offer it in the first place unless you change the description to read for a short distance and the pad is minimal? It serves no purpose.  I gave it a chance knowing it was described as "minimal" and immediately sent it back.
review.name: Why Does Pearl Izumi Offer This Product

review.reviewBody:
I should have read the one other review on these shorts before purchasing for my wife. She was wanting some cycling shorts to wear under leggings or street pants. I had just bought her some PI road shorts that she likes, but these liner shorts just don't work for her and I doubt they work for anyone.

There is no rubber in the leg hems to keep the shorts from riding up into your crotch, so that exactly what they do on a ride. If you try to wear these under leggings, they bunch up as you pull on the tights.  

The removable chamois is touted as a feature, but don't be fooled. This foam pad is super thin and doesn't provide much cushioning. It comes out for hand washing, but is not easy to get back in. Extremely disappointed in Pearl Izumi.
review.name: Bad design ZERO STARS

review.reviewBody: Like the description says, the chamois is removable, and it's very thin. There is a channel sewn in to the shorts to hold the chamois. It's stitched along the sides and open in the front and the back so it can be pulled out easily. The issue I have with these shorts is the chamois bunches up when you put them on and I spend a good amount of time straightening out the chamois and making sure it's not rolled onto itself. Might work well for others but they're not for me.
review.name: Not for me

name: Minimal Liner Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Clarity trail lens is cristal clear on the trails!!!! The frame is a bit on the big size but it's fine...guess it's more protection for the eyes and beyond.
review.name: Clarity tech is amazing

review.reviewBody:
Love these.  Amazing coverage with great vision, fit great with a TLD A3.  Bonus, they also fit great with the TLD Stage, and probably other lightweight full face helmets, and you don't have to wear goggles.  
Pricey, but excellent.  Put about 50 days on em, and lenses are doing well.  For reference, Oakley, Smith, and other POC lenses never last me more than 30ish days before they're scratched.
review.name: Huge, great fit, excellent optics

review.reviewBody: I love the quality and look and they come with a clear glass so you can swap em out, love it!
review.name: These glasses are great!

review.reviewBody:
I?ve tried more sunglasses for cycling than I?d like to admit. I?ve been searching for that sweet spot of fit, style, and most importantly, glasses that don?t fog up while I?m out mountain biking.

While these glasses were a little more than I was hoping to spend, and a little larger than glasses I normally wear, I was pleasantly surprised to find that I put these on and FORGOT ABOUT THEM. No fuss, no fog, no moving around on my face. These things are light for such a large lens, and I didn?t get any weird pressure points on my nose or ears. The fit with my helmet was perfect, which is also POC. 

Lots of people have said this already, but these things look and perform like goggles, but with a sunglass frame. I?m a fan!
review.name: Best of the best

review.reviewBody:
These have been terrific on the road and trails. Lenses are super easy to swap out depending on conditions! 
Adjustable temples for a customizable fit depending on head size and helmet shape is a huge plus if using these for multiple disciplines. 

For the size of the lense they vent very well (better than my 100% speed crafts or my Oakley windjackets) 

2 lenses is always a bonus and should be expected at this price point.
review.name: Basically goggles...

review.reviewBody: These glasses are awesome. Right when I got them and put them on I knew that there was something great. That huge lens provides such a nice field of view and the frame keeps the glasses a good distance away from your face so it doesn't get dirty or fog up. They look and feel like you are wearing goggles when you have them on. Super comfortable and the adjustable temple arms make it even better!
review.name: Killer Glasses Huge FOV

review.reviewBody: While these may in fact devour your face (if it's tiny), they will also certainly help you devour the trails. The POC Devour sunglasses featuring the clarity lens technology has become an instant favorite. A fan of oversized sunglasses, they pair perfectly with the POC Tectal helmet (or Kortal or Axion Spin). The ventilation in the lens prevents fogging and allows for adequate airflow. The adjustable arms allow for the perfect fit. While I'd love for the nose piece to be a bit more snug, they've yet to go anywhere on bumpy terrain. From low-light days to the sunniest of days, you'll be able to see clearly in and out of the trees, no matter the trail. You can't go wrong with the POC Devour Sunglasses this summer.
review.name: Devour the Trails

name: Devour Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I was surprised with the vision of the lens, you can see that everything stands out, it lets some light through but very comfortable on sunny days, the materials have nothing to envy of other brands, very good purchasing decision, now I'm going for others .
review.name: Great Sunglasses!!

review.reviewBody: I really loved the lenses, etc on these.. but if they were to "bend like pipecleaners" as still quoted from their advertising.. I would still have one of the two pairs that i purchased. I didn't expect Smith to replace the first pair which came off in light surf... but the pair that simply fell from my face onto a supermarket parking lot.. cracking the glass lense.. i thought might be fair. Smith did not agree. Have to say though that it still annoys me to see this description still on their website. DO NOT expect them to wrap around your ears. They don't bend much.. and quickly revert to original shape. ...
review.name: Great glasses.. but they DO NOT bend like pipecleaners

review.reviewBody: I love smith glasses l have a pair of Maui Jim's and like my smith's better
review.name: I love smith glasses l

review.reviewBody: They fit well and the lenses are vivid on the water
review.name: They fit well and the

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th or 5th pair. Unfortunately a couple have broken over the years,
review.name: This is my 4th or

review.reviewBody: They fit good,feel comfortable.I like the wide lens.Think that'll be good for saltwater Fly fishing.I know they'll be ultra clear and great for inshore,brining out the features underwater.I haven't used them yet because I live in UT and had to cancel my trip to Hawaii.Looking forward to using them sometime in the near future.
review.name: They fit good,feel comfortable.I like

review.reviewBody: I like the performance of the sunglasses but they fit a bit large on my face and protrude out on the sides too much. Overall I like them but if I had a change to try them on before buying, I'd probably not buy again.
review.name: Mostly Happy with my Deck Boss

review.reviewBody: I really appreciate the custom fit that these sunnies have with the ear piece. They are light and stick to my face which is what we want! They definitely are a larger fit with full coverage. With that said, I have the guide choice and castaway….they don’t stay put as well, but they also don’t fog up on me while sweating…. The deckboss does. I hope that Smith integrates the custom ear fit into all active models and introduce a slightly smaller fit option for the deckboss.
review.name: I really appreciate the custom

review.reviewBody: Don’t have a single pair of smiths that I don’t love! Only thing better than the quality is the service!
review.name: Don’t have a single pair

review.reviewBody: Not only are the Deck Boss glasses comfortable to wear through an entire day of fishing but the polarized mirror lenses are second to none when spotting fish.
review.name: Extremely comfortable for all day fishing

review.reviewBody: The goggles are a nice fit and they stay fog free. We used them during skiing with a helmet and sledding with no helmet.
review.name: Nice fit with & without helmet 4 yr old

review.reviewBody: Tiny tike loves the feel and look of these awesome goggles
review.name: Tiny tike loves the feel

review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of these being used by my kids and keep coming back to them because of their fit and quality.
review.name: Quality goggles at a great price!

review.reviewBody: Bought for my daughter (6) and son (4). Fits their little faces well.
review.name: Great intro goggles

review.reviewBody: Great goggles! The kids loved them and they worked perfectly with their helmets.
review.name: Great goggles! The kids loved

review.reviewBody: We bought two sets, one for each of our boys, and are very happy with these goggles! My six y/o has a Smith Zoom Jr. helmet, and these fit perfectly on the helmet. The additional non-slip on the inside of the strap is ideal for wearing outside the helmet (it would likely be uncomfortable to wear inside). On my four y/o's Marker helmet, the goggles also work great, even though I am less excited about how the Marker helmet fits. Both my kids found the goggles comfortable and liked the cool designs available. Highly recommend buying the Smith helmet with these, though it might be nice to have some different lens options for low vis days.
review.name: Perfect goggles for both my kids.

review.reviewBody: Perfect goggles for my 5 year old. There is no struggle to get them on and keep them on. Plus the cool design helps me identify her easily in a pack of kids. Highly recommend for your little ones!
review.name: Perfect for our five year old.

review.reviewBody: The foam liner peeled away on the 2nd day my daughter used it. Use was only in ski school and 1 ski run down the mountain. Seems very low quality adhesive or just some manufacturing issue.
review.name: The foam liner peeled away

review.reviewBody: Love them! They fit my little boy perfectly! Great quality Product!
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my 2.5 yo who hates wearing sunglasses and hats - and he loved them! They're a great fit and the tint seems to be fine. Haven't tried them on the snow yet, but relieved to be all set for next season!
review.name: Great for little kids!

description: Buy the Camp Chef Deluxe Barbecue Box online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deluxe Barbecue Box
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Deluxe Barbecue Box online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love this Camp Chef grill, but what made it better was Back Country! The price was exceptional, ordering was easy and my grill arrived quickly. This is my new go to place for all of my outdoor needs. You won't be disappointed!
review.name: Great company, great product!

review.reviewBody: I bought this three weeks ago, am enjoying it right out of the box. I have been using Outdoor Cooking products for many years, this is my third grill box and I recently bought a two burner stove for its exclusive use. I also have a three burner stove where I use the amazing pizza oven and keep a burner open for pots or frying. I’ve used your products for over fifteen years and have been satisfied!
review.name: Great Gas Grill

review.reviewBody: Bought this to go along with my 60x and for portability. It works better than the old gas grill on my patio!
review.name: Love how I can pack it around wherever we heading

review.reviewBody: I purchased this box 6 years ago and after many many uses through all seasons it worked its magic.  I had to retire it and get a new one.  The only modification that I ever did to my box was to add light weight chain to the sides of the lid so when you open it the strain is not on the hinges.  I will post a coiple pics of the chain add on when my new one arrives.  Never took pics of the first one.
review.name: Darn good grill box

review.reviewBody: For a 1st time on-line purchase I'm truly impressed with my Grill Box and the how fast it was delivered. If you do have a gas two burner * I call stove - buy one and you must get the grill box, best two items ever!!
review.name: I purchased an accessory * best item ever

review.reviewBody: I have been using these grills for years.  I have been through 3 SPG90B models and now have aTB90LWG grill.  Love these grills, great for backyard cookouts, camping and whatever a grill is needed for.   It is a little heavy to move about, but I made some rollers and attached them to grill legs and now moving this grill is a breeze.  I do wish the grill box and outside parts of grill  were made a bit thicker, then I could use grill longer, but I keep continuing to use these grills and a few friends of mine have also purchased these grills and really like theirs.  Really great grill.
review.name: Great Grill

review.reviewBody: Very good addition to our camping and hunting trips
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Bought my Camp Chef Explorer 60 about 5-7 year ago only used it once... Then burned out 3 gas grills and a charcoal grill I seen the grill box and bought it. Love it since it is easy to smoke and great for grilling. I use Jack Daniel Barrel Chips for smoking which I put on one burner area, medium to low heat and leave the other burner on warm. fantastic flavor.
review.name: Grillin and Smokin'

review.reviewBody: Useing this grill when caming with Boy Scouts. Great fit on the duell jet burner. Best grill we brought to date.
review.name: Great Grill, should have brought it soon

review.reviewBody: The grill provides even heat over the entire surface.  The heavy cast iron grates are easy to clean and are excellent for seering.Smok
review.name: Impressive, excellent for grilling steak

name: Deluxe Barbecue Box

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and supportive, great for car camping or travel. Packs down nicely.

I purchased this pillow to replace my Klymit Pillow X because I’m a side sleeper and it just doesn’t quite do it for me. I made it 2 days through my 5 day back country camp out before my girlfriend ended up with it on her side and wouldn’t give it back. She loves it! It packs down small, is very comfortable, and not loud like the blow up pillows. I will be purchasing another for myself! The reversible cover is also pretty nice.
review.name: Excellent Pillow or so I’m told

review.reviewBody: Great camping pillow.  A little big for ultra light backpacking but great for tent camping with the family.  Almost feels like home.  Best pillow I have found.  It’s medium firmness and rebounds quick from being squashed down.  Only neg is they don’t include the compression strap anymore and it’s the same price.  Other than that it’s great.
review.name: Great camping pillow

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a comfortable, light, car camping pillow that had some fluff to it. This checks all of the boxes.
review.name: Amazingly comfortable

review.reviewBody: The double sided pillow case is awesome, don’t have to worry about it getting gross when you stuff it in your pack
review.name: Great pack pillow

review.reviewBody: Looking forward to using this camping pillow next week. Pillow compacts nicely and fluffs up to usable comfort.
review.name: Fluffy camp pillow

review.reviewBody: this pillow is outstanding. packs down nicely.  doubt id use it backpacking but for car camping. you can't find a better pillow.
review.name: just buy one

review.reviewBody: This pillow has been packed up, thrown around, used and abused then washed, dried and repeat. Still in great condition and my go to pillow to grab for any adventure be it hiking, hunting, travel, you name it. It’s nice to have a pillow of your own that you know won’t let you down when you’re running around away from home. Highly recommend the Klymit Travel Pillow if your looking for a durable pillow for any condition.
review.name: Best travel pillow

review.reviewBody: Great camp pillow, not the most packable size, but very comfortable and sleeps very well.  The interchangeable fabrics on the pillowcase is also a plus.
small and compact, but still full enough for good night sleep.
review.name: Perfect camping pillow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this beanie. Insulated inside w/reflective material for warmth. Perfect size. Great quality.
review.name: Beanie for Snow season.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect beanie. Right size, warmth and simple style.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is nice and I like it. Not making so warm like old weighty hats but as it light and fits nicely it is doing the job. In general I do not wear too much hat and gloves so for person like me it is fine.
review.name: Good quality and nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Soft and Cozy material, well made. Similar to military grade fleece.
review.name: Not too bulky, good material

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Living in cold temps during the winter and we keep house in lower 60s so a comfortable hat that works both indoors and out is key.  This hat meets all the check marks. (Own officially 3 different colors of same!)
review.name: Comfort extraordinaire

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality hat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.name: Super warm and soft!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these beanies! Simple but warm and fits my head without being too tight
review.name: Live these

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been wearing the previous version of this hat for a number of years. This one is a bit larger but ok for big heads with lots of hair.  So far it’s plenty warm.  We bought 2 so there is no competition for the hat!  Probably will buy again in a few years
review.name: A comfortable hat for someone who only wears them

review.reviewBody:
Sizing a hat/beanie is tough. I probably fall squarely between the S/M and L/XL. 

The L/XL is slightly too large around my head. Even worse, it doesn't come down far enough to completely cover my ears. Standing outside in 20 or 30 degree weather would mean my ear lobes would be cold, which is a fail for a hat/beanie. 

If Columbia could make it slightly longer and tighter around my head, it would be perfect. This misses the mark on almost all fronts sadly.
review.name: Thin fleece. Not long enough
comment: Hey there! We are really sorry the fit didn't hit the mark for you. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s such a warm, comfortable, and lightweight hat. It fits perfectly on my head, and I absolutely love it.

review.reviewBody: I have these on 3 bikes and as a spare for a gravel race bike that runs tubeless.  I do a lot of big mountains and I like the low weight.  Puncture far less than rubber. I live in an agricultural area and metal is everywhere. A downside is that a patch requires 30 minutes to cure. But the patches hold. Over 5 years and thousands of miles I've patched some 2 or 3 times and use as spares. No patch has ever failed.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
As a self-professed weight weenie, I enthusiastically swap out bits and pieces on my bikes for lighter and/or more exotic ones...which is why I so excited to try these tubes.  Gram for gram, particularly for rotating mass, these seemed like a great upgrade.   I purchased two tubes and a 5 patch kit, and six rides later I am out of patches and neither tube will hold air for long enough to be useful.

Perhaps the most frustrating thing with these tubes is that they WILL hold air for hours when testing for leaks, but put them in a tire and go for a ride and within an hour they will randomly lose air.  Incredibly frustrating, as there is no possible way to locate and patch such a slow leak when out on the road...not that the patches seem to reliably hold anyway.

Gave them two stars because the are definitely lightweight, very compact, and they seem to hold air reasonably well until patched for the first time.
review.name: Ride ruiners

name: Tubo Road Tube

review.reviewBody: In the photo it looked like just a casual dress.  When I received it the fit is flattering and with different shoes and sometimes a belt it can be dressed up or down,  I love the pockets that did not add any bulk when I put my keys in one.
review.name: Wonderful Surprise

review.reviewBody: I wore this before washing and it fit perfectly! I washed it on cold and dried on low heat and now it does not fit.  It's not just tighter, it is also shorter.  I do like the style so I may buy it again in a much larger size to accommodate the shrinkage issue but it would have to be marked down lower than it is.
review.name: It shrunk, terribly
comment:
Hi Nicole!

I'm so sorry about the damage to your dress.  With 100% cotton garments like this I have had the same experience, and prefer to line dry to be on the safe side.  That said, please feel free to reach out via phone or chat we'd be happy to return or exchange this for you!

review.reviewBody:
I'm obsessed with this dress! It's comfortable, has a nice cut to it. It has pockets! The sleeves are a little shorter than I usually have but it's ok. It's also a nice length I feel appropriate and covered in it but not too fartsy. Plus I love the color green.
I'm usually between a size 6 and 8 I ordered the Medium
review.name: New Favorite Dress

description: Buy the Giro LA DND Glove - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: LA DND Glove - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro LA DND Glove - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I think my hands are average sized and the medium gloves fit me well. They are snug and comfortable. My palm measures 7.3 cm in width and my hand is 16.3 cm in length. Giro is my go-to brand for affordable, quality gear.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody:
I've had these gloves for over 3 years now and the only sign of wear is that the fabric over the thumb (mine is black) has faded to a weird brown color. But structurally, these have held up amazingly. The nose wipe area could be a little softer but that hasn't been enough of an issue to make me buy a new pair. I am able to use my phone with them on, but it's pretty clumsy. Well enough to be able to stop and take a picture while riding though.

I have small hands and have found it difficult to buy gloves that have fingers short enough for my hands (and I don't think I have 'short' fingers!) but these fit really well and seem actually sized for women's hands. I got a medium after reading reviews.
review.name: 3 years and still going

review.reviewBody: Fit like you aren?t wearing gloves, so you have excellent dexterity on the bike. No padding. Meant to fit slim/ small. The seams do not last long, unfortunately. I have to buy a new replacement pair every year.
review.name: Slim, minimal gloves

review.reviewBody: Really love the flexibility in the knuckles and the grippy silicone on the fingers for shifting; however, I like my Giro Rivette?s better only because I can use my phone with them.  Often I?m on a new trail and need to reference a map to figure out where to go next, and while I love these gloves, I have to take them off which is a bummer.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Read other reviews and sized up to a medium.  I would normally wear a small in gloves.  These stretch well and have nice grip.  Would recommend!
review.name: Great MTB gloves, runs small

review.reviewBody: I like these gloves so much I just ordered another pair as a backup but I didn't bother looking at the size. I am a small to medium person, almost 5'5, slender athletic build. My hands are NOT big. I ordered size medium and I can barely stretch them over my hands. I will return for large, which apparently is what I already had, so at least they are consistent. I love the fact that there is no velcro, just elastic at the wrist, and they have held up very well considering that I only swap them with one other pair and I prefer these! I have the black ones with the black dots, nice design.
review.name: Great gloves! Run small

review.reviewBody: I'm thankful I read the rest of the reviews on these gloves before purchasing. I usually wear a small in almost everything, and would consider myself to have tinier hands, but in these Giro gloves I wear a size Medium and they fit perfectly. Very snug, stylish, and I can still use my phone with them thanks to the grippy finger pads. I really enjoy the fabric texture of these as well.
review.name: Read The Reviews - These Run Small

name: LA DND Glove - Women's

Description is misleading. 
This will not fit a 35mm diameter handlebar such as the OS-35 Highside 80mm Rise Handlebar. Spoke to support who told me a 35mm handle bar diameter will fit inside a 31.8 diameter stem. What? Don't make this mistake because BC won't pay for return shipping.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are amazing to keep the rain out on hikes in the Pacific Northwest. The whole family bought Columbia rain pants to keep us dry on the Oregon Coast, and we'll use them again in the Olympic Peninsula this spring. These work great. Roomy enough to fit over regular pants.
review.name: Stay dry on rainy hikes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit and work great. Used them on a camping trip and got rained on. Kept me dry and they kept me warm by blocking the wind. Big opening on bottom so you can throw them on while wearing shoes/boots. Lightweight and pack easily. Would recommend 10/10
review.name: For and work great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s rain resistant so does the job. Tested in the Pacific Northwest weather. However it’s a little too thick; closer to a ski pant
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They seem waterproof.. haven’t really needed them much yet. Definitely wish they had pockets; however, super packable and easy to slip on over clothing in a pinch as I deliver parcel.
review.name: Convenient to have.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s underwhelming. No style. Baggy and loose. But I guess it does the job of being waterproof
review.name: Meh

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased for golf, Great Product, Great Price. Gets the job done
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: They run a bit big but that's perfect for my needs. I give them to my float fishing clients when the storms roll in. They easily fit over my clients street clothes. That way the clients don't have wear Waders during the hot summer months.
review.name: Keeps the rain out

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice pants should hold up well.  They are a little on the long side.
review.name: Great Rain Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are exactly what I had been looking for.  My husband and I have been so happy with the rain jackets, we needed the pants to go further on our adventures.  They are perfect.
review.name: Perfect Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are a great length, perfect to wear over other clothes and they work great!
review.name: Awesome pants

name: Rebel Roamer Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Light for hikes and running. Just enough for biking.
review.name: Good all-around

review.reviewBody: Ordered, delivered. Satisfied customer. Comfortable, useful, snug. What else can you say? Good product; good service. ✅✅
review.name: Excellent purchase

review.reviewBody: This is my 5th pair of Smith sunglasses purchased in the past 24 years..I love them just as much as all my others. They are similar to the mainlines that they will eventually replace. I still have 3 pairs of Smith sunglasses which speaks to their durability and lasting ability.
review.name: 24th straight year of only Smith sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I bought these primarily for trail running - I wanted a ChromaPop lens with a little less coverage than the Bobcats. Unfortunately, the glasses are pretty large and constantly slip while I'm running. The ChromaPop lens is amazing, and the glasses themselves are incredibly light weight and have fantastic air flow. But if you have a smaller face these probably aren't for you. Hoping Smith comes out with more sports glasses for smaller faces since the Bobcats are really the only ones I can find, and they are a bit large for running.
review.name: Great Lenses, Large Fit

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight sunnies for running! Good coverage and great vis.
review.name: Had to replace my 10 year old Smith’s.

review.reviewBody: Like them. Lens are difficult to get out for cleaning and they could fit a little tighter. Other than that they are good.
review.name: Like them. Lens are difficult

review.reviewBody: Good quality and fit. Wrap around coverage is helpful when I'm driving and the sun is over my shoulder.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: they are a cool, and functional style, but they are already chipping a little on the bottom edge.
review.name: they are a cool, and

review.reviewBody: I bought these glasses as a Christmas gift for my son. He loved them!
review.name: I bought these glasses as

review.reviewBody: Great fit and perfect amount of coverage for your eyes and face. I don’t get fogged in the winter riding while sweating. Great comfort with the nose softness. Haven’t used the darker lenses but, the clear ones are great!
review.name: Fantastic glasses!!

name: Resolve ChromaPop Sunglasses

hasVariant.description: Buy the Race Face T2 Tailgate Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a 2024 Toyota Tundra and I couldn’t mount it by myself. I needed at least 2 extra hands. This product has a terrible design flaw that clearly wasn’t thought through properly. Instead of having straps start from within the truck bed, they put them on the outside. This requires fighting against gravity trying to shove those straps through tiny cracks between the tailgate and the bumper. What a disastrous design choice. Took me 45 minutes to attach 2 out of 4 straps and I gave up. Returning this item at my own cost :(
review.name: Disaster of a design flow

review.reviewBody: Really like this pad.  I have a Ford F150 which has a curved tailgate and with all the straps across the top, you can make it fit pretty well. The adjustable hole for the latch and rear view camera is great.  It's well padded to protect the bikes and bikes strap in securely and don't move or flop over.  Really happy for the price.
review.name: Great tailgate pad

review.reviewBody: Easy to put on and take off.  The side that comes in contact with the paint is very soft.  We've hauled 5 bikes several times now and had no issues.  The bikes never come in contact with the truck when the pad is on.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: This is a very well made tailgate in all aspects,, but really doesnt fit a 2019 Ram 1500 tailgate.  the tail gate is wide and variable thickness at the top the pad doesnt cinch well without some bunching of the fabric.  The bikes feel very secure - overall I like the pad, but would have liked it to be more clear on the fit for the Ram Truck
review.name: Well made, but doesnt fit great.

review.reviewBody: I?ve had several tailgate pads and historically the old raceface pad was the best I have owned although it didn?t fit newer truck tailgates and it would deteriorate pretty quickly.  This pad is made of better and seemingly longer lasting materials than the last but doesn?t seem to hold your bikes in place as well as the old pad and it fits my newer F150 tailgate but not that well.  I had the Dakine DLX before this pad and that seemed to fit my tailgate better but was definitely a mediocre pad at best.  The old Raceface pad was a terrific pad even though it fell apart but this newer pad is a good pad at best that does seem like it will last longer.  Hoping that the next rendition of this pad is just the tits.
review.name: Still not as good as the first

review.reviewBody: I looked for the prefect tailgate mat and I found it.  With my wider tailgate this covers it perfect. I like that it doesn?t cover up my back up camera.  I recommend it.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
I bought the 5 bike tailgate pad for primarily my Toyota Tacoma. I thought I could use it on my Chevy Silverado but the straps are too short for the full size truck tailgate.

Not sure if the wider one will fit, but I'm a little disappointed that this pad cannot be used on both trucks.
review.name: quality, but careful of the fit

review.reviewBody: Worked great on my 2015 Ram 1500. Larger size opening that doesn?t at all interfere with the back up camera! Takes some maneuvering to get it tight and snug, but it works great!
review.name: Very pleased with the fit!
comment: What size did you get? I have a Ram 1500 too and am trying to find a tailgate pad.

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend this pad. Keeps tailgate and bumper protected. The pads keeps the  wheel from scuffing the bumper. Also my rear  camera is not blocked
review.name: Race Face T2 Tailgate Pad

name: T2 Tailgate Pad

review.reviewBody: My son loves it! He had a similar color that was stolen. So I got this one for him and he loves it! Will be ordering more soon!
review.name: I will sure buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Really disappointed in these. They were mainly white and had barely any black swirl in them. The majority of the black swirling was all at the bottom of the shoe and you obviously can't see that. I would definitely have to say in the future if I'm ever gonna buy a marble crock, I'm going to buy it in a store and not online.
review.name: Don't take the risk online!

review.reviewBody: I wear a lot of earth toned basic pieces and the khaki marbled ones were closest to white without being white that I could wear with all of my business casual outfits. It goes with lots of colors. I have Pokémon Jibbitz on them and they're so cute.
review.name: Love the khaki bone one..

review.reviewBody: The product is great overall but the colors and not as marbled as I thought, there's a few spots not marbled which makes me kind of mad but the looks of it is amazing and the color choices are decent
review.name: Good product but marbling off

review.reviewBody: These are SO ugly lol. The color is was worse in person. I covered them in jibbitz to help but they're still nasty.

review.reviewBody: This goes with nearly all my outfits.. I love it. I put Pokémon jibbitz on it.. so cute
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Too big. Like the size of a 14 shoe!! It would cost me more to send it back from here in Iraq than I was willing to pay.
review.name: Nope!!

review.reviewBody: Love the pink/mauve marble design, just had to get them.
review.name: Marble.

review.reviewBody: These are great. They get many compliments and they are very comfortable to wear

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband for Christmas. He loves them. They fit perfect.
review.name: My husband loves these

review.reviewBody: This pants are exactly what we were looking for, comfortable and soft. Fit well.
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: These pants made everything easy to do.....Sitting...Standing and swinging...
review.name: You will like this....

review.reviewBody: My husband is super picky with his clothes, but he really liked these pants for in the office work days. He said they look professional and are very comfortable. By the way, he commutes to work so these pants will be worn in the NYC subways. So, it’s important that they can be washed and look good without ironing as I gave that up awhile ago. I will be ordering the navy blue color for him now too. He also said he can wear them without a belt, which is a plus. He is 5’11”, 210, this week, after Christmas, and they were comfortable! I got him a 38 x 30.
review.name: Comfortable pants

review.reviewBody: Needed dark slacks to wear for daytime, golf, and casual evening dining. Flexibility permits packing light for travel  These slacks fit well and do the job
review.name: Exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: Good multi-purpose pant. I use for professional look at work and also for traveling.
review.name: Good multi-purpose pant

review.reviewBody: These are the best golf pants!  The features are wonderful.  I also appreciate all the color options.  My husband and sons all have them.
review.name: Great golf pants

review.reviewBody: Great fit, comfortable and exactly what I was looking for
These pants fit extreme well. The material is so comfortable and stretches so well. They don’t wrinkle at all.
review.name: Extremely comfortable

review.reviewBody:
My old golf pants finally let me down the day before an PGA invitational. In a panic I ran to the nearest golf supply store store to buy a replacement. I was skeptical at first but after the 3rd hole I was glad I bought them. They have just the right amount of give in the seat area. I am very happy with them and I will buy more
In the future.
review.name: These pants are super comfortable and wrinkle free

name: Drive Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Really like this coat
review.name: Patagonia

review.reviewBody: This is a great fitting lightweight jacket for this short petite woman! It feels fairly durable for warmer weather use. It could use more insulation, not warm enough for cool weather (Fall or Spring) in Northern CA, even with layers.
review.name: Nice Fit, Lightweight

review.reviewBody: I have a navy nanopuff from 2018. Love it and have worn it every cold day for YEARS. I bought the new one just for a new color. The navy is lasting forever and I just wanted another!!!
review.name: Wanted! Didn’t need!!

review.reviewBody: I love my Nano Puff jacket. I searched for the jacket in the dark gray color in Atlanta stores and could not find it. Went online and discovered Backcountry not only had the jacket I was looking for but also it was on sale!  I will be taking the jacket on a 3-week trip to Europe in October. Thank you, Backcountry!
review.name: Patagonia Nano Puff jacket

review.reviewBody: I've bought a few of these jackets 3 - 5 years ago, that I still use. I ordered this one in my same usual size (XL) to enjoy a new color. Returned first one because although it fit the same, the torso and sleeves were about 5 inches too long, and that much longer compared to my previous ones. Customer service repr. was very nice, said perhaps it was a defect, and sent me another. Second one has same issue and I'll be returning it.
review.name: Great, but torso and sleeves too long

review.reviewBody: Teens asked for this.   Fits great.   Good quality.  I recommend
review.name: True to size

review.reviewBody: This jacket has been great!  It has a nice fit and classic design. It is lighter weight than the Radalie jacket but still keeps me plenty warm.
review.name: Classic jacket

review.reviewBody: Love the weight and warmth of this jacket. It is very soft and comfortable. I would give it five stars except for the sizing. I ordered my usual medium and it was too snug. Ordered a large and the sleeves were 4 inches too long. Kept the medium. Please shorten the sleeves.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a recent trip to Europe. I wanted something lightweight, easy to pack, that would go with everything, and be warm enough for the off-season trip. It was perfect!
review.name: Lightweight yet warm jacket

review.reviewBody: Nice style and color. Just don’t like how the collar doesn’t lay down so it pokes my neck sometimes.
review.name: Love the light weight

These modern Gripshifts are light years away from the ones I had on my GT growing up. Fast, precise shifts, and there's nothing better than reaching the top of a climb and shifting straight from one end of the cassette to the other.
review.name: Lighter, cheaper, more durable... pick 3

review.reviewBody: I bought the black 70l one with some rewards and on sale (ended up about half the price), and I would definitely pay full price for this. The tote is durable and seems well made. My favourite features are the small pockets for a couple of easily lost items and the handles on the ends for carrying with another person when it's full. I got this for car camping in a small hatchback so we could easily move all our gear to the front seat when switching the back of the car into sleeping mode. It also makes it easier to pack the car for camping, because everything we need is stored in the tote in a closet until we need to bring it to the car. Way easier than other kinds of luggage for this use case. I'm thinking about buying the smaller totes for the footwells in the car.
review.name: Great tote

review.reviewBody: We have a Kuiu version of this bag which was much more expensive and we use it all the time. We bought this to store our tent equipment in and are blown away by the quality. I think it’s actually nicer than the more expensive one. I’m buying more
review.name: Worth every penny

review.reviewBody:
I ski bum and use the heck out of my gear, day in and day out. 
I love this thing so much I am getting another (to haul both pairs of snowboard boots and ski boots for me and my partner). I love that it's super tough & durable, and doesn't leak melted snow. It is not in fact floppy at all, has a ton of functionality with the side pocket and velcro at the top holding the two straps together. It feels super high quality - BOMBER!
At the end of the day we stick it in the shower to drain and BOOM, it's ready for more adventures.
review.name: This thing rocks, buying another

review.reviewBody: This is my go to tote when I need to put together my camping dry goods or I'm heading to the mountain for a bike ride or ski day. Its made of a super durable ripstop material that holds up well against dirt, parking lots and moisture. Plenty of room to throw all the essentials you may need for a weekend camping or all my gear for the activity that day. The top buckle comes in clutch when you want to keep everything from shifting while you are driving in your car. Totally recommend this to anyone looking for a great reusable tote. #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Versatile and Durable

review.reviewBody:
I take this on every road trip. It’s well made and so perfect to throw loose items into. I often have it filled with snacks, water bottles, protein powder and even a nutribullet blender for use in the car and also to easily take into a hotel. It’s built well enough for more rugged use than I’ll probably ever put it through, but I do appreciate the extra durable and waterproof material on the bottom of it because I never have to be careful where I set it down. 

I have also used this bag to haul items to family gatherings. It’s one of three totes that I have, and definitely my favorite one!
review.name: A must have for road trips

name: All Around 70L Gear Tote

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody: Bought this half size bigger as suggested by other reviews. It fits perfect for thin to medium thickness socks. I walked around the house for mayne 15 min, and it felt comfortable. During my trip to Austria and Findland during the winter, and was walking 4-5hrs straight, boy, I regretted not testing the shoes out longer. After 1-2hrs of walking, it starting to feel tight in the toes, and the back of the shoes constantly rubbing on the high anke, and it gave me a good skin abrasive. I had to buy longer socks to protect the area.
review.name: Runs small, not comfort for prolong walk

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody: These are the best boots I’ve ever had. I went a half size up and glad I did. They are perfect and look and feel incredible!
review.name: Awesome boots!

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody: So warm and confortable.
review.name: Great bots

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody:
As someone who enjoys outdoor activities year-round, investing in a quality pair of boots is paramount. After an extensive search, I decided to try out the Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 boots, and I must say I'm impressed with their performance in extreme cold conditions.

The first thing I noticed upon receiving the boots was their solid and durable construction. The waterproof leather upper combined with GORE-TEX technology provides exceptional protection against moisture, keeping my feet dry even in rain and snow.

Comfort is another standout feature of these boots. The cushioning in the midsole and padded insole offer excellent support during long walks, while the ergonomic design ensures a comfortable and secure fit.

One of the features I appreciate most is their ability to retain heat in extremely cold conditions. The Exo Hi MTE-3 boots feature PrimaLoft insulation that keeps my feet warm even in sub-zero temperatures, making them an ideal choice for winter outdoor activities.

Regarding performance on challenging terrains, these boots do not disappoint. The Vibram outsole provides exceptional traction on slippery and rocky surfaces, giving me the confidence to venture into any terrain.

While the price may seem a bit high, I consider these boots worth every penny due to their quality construction, comfort, and performance in extreme conditions. In summary, the Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 boots are an excellent investment for those seeking durable and reliable footwear to face the cold and adversity in their outdoor adventures.
review.name: Performance and Protection in Extreme

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody: I’ve had them since February and they are already coming apart. These shoes were way to expensive to have them falling apart after 2 and a half months of owning them and only a handful of  times wearing them. The product also runs right/small.  I would not recommend they are not worth the money they cost. This is ridiculous!
review.name: THESE ARE FALLING APART

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody: I ordered my regular size which is 8.5 and this shoe was way too tight even with thinner socks, go up a half size if you want a comfortable fit.
review.name: Runs Small, Size Up

review.itemreviewed: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe
review.reviewBody:
I was in the market for a pair of new hiking boots. Found these and got super excited because they look great. I daily Vans sneakers, so these really tickled my fancy. I bought the Demitasse pair in women?s 8.5, my normal size in Vans sneakers.

After I ordered these I saw a couple ladies on Vans website saying to order half a size up. I was worried they?d be too small, but they fit great after typical boot adjustments. They are stiff but I think after a few walks with my doggos they?ll be broken in and hike ready!
review.name: Really like these!

name: Ultrarange Exo Hi GORE-TEX MTE-3 Shoe

review.reviewBody: They look and feel very high quality. The lenses are also very good.
review.name: Best Sunglasses for the money

review.reviewBody: Amazing sunglasses, the material and the look is so cool!!!
review.name: Very Happy with my purchase!!!

review.reviewBody: These glasses fit my face wonderfully and I love the sleek, fun, vibey look of the amber frames. They have become my everyday sun glasses and I'm spreading the word about Sunski for sure!
review.name: Sunski Bernina Sun Glasses Are Awesome!

review.reviewBody: The glasses look great! They feel really well made and comfortable. I’ve been shopping for sunglasses for six months at least with Maui Jim’s being my standard and these feel almost the exact same quality for a third of the price.
review.name: Solid go to pair of sunglasses

review.reviewBody: This model looks much more expensive than it is. Very well made and sturdy construction.
review.name: Bang for your buck

review.reviewBody: Love these sunglasses! I have a smaller head, narrow face and these are perfect. Also love the lens color, gives everything a wonderful warm look and feels calming actually.
review.name: Definitely buy!

review.reviewBody: These sunglasses feel amazing. They’re light but sturdy and I loved the nose pads. Unfortunately they were too small to flatter my face or my partner’s. Held onto them for about a year but never ended up wearing them because of the size. Gave them to a friend and they look amazing on her smaller face and she wears them non stop. Really with they made a medium size in this frame as the estero is just not my style.
review.name: Loved them. Too small

review.reviewBody: Great quality and the lenses are dark enough for my eyes! They feel sturdy and keep my hair up when they're up!
review.name: Great sunglasses!

review.reviewBody: Too narrow and frame part way too small even for a small face. Go with the Baia
review.name: Nah
comment: Sorry that the Bernina didn't fit you but glad you found the Baia :) We sent you an email in case you have any questions!

review.reviewBody: These are super sturdy and high quality sunnies  great for basically whatever. I wear them all the time.  Love the shape also—really flattering and unique
