review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. Very comfortable. I did have to go a half size and the heel slips a little. I think thicker socks will help.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: These are super cool looking. I went with a 7 and I’m overall fairly happy with the fit. The heel rubs a little, so I’ll have to break that in. I did have to put in some insoles, so if you have high arches, you may consider sizing up a half size if you’re on the edge of a size and will likely need to use insoles.
review.name: Cool, decent fit, needs more arch support.

review.reviewBody: Good looking shoe, comfortable, except that the heal bed seems a little low set. I will be trying a slight lift support in it to compensate.
review.name: Comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: Missed the mark for me. They are very heavy and very clunky. Just not very practical. They run incredibly narrow as well. I always size up in Sorel and even the 1/2 size up was too tight. Unfortunately, these are a return for me.
review.name: Missed the mark
comment: Hello Teesforme, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our CARIBOU™ X Women's Waterproof Shoe is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I loved the look of this shoe, but unfortunately it was too hard and stiff for me. The size was not a problem but the rigid sole caused sock slippage at the heel for me. Also, the harder sole is not sustainable for all day wear and needs a supportive insole. This style is super cute and worth trying but I had to return them.
review.name: Looks great but didn’t work for me
comment: Hello MW, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry CARIBOU™ X Women's Waterproof Shoe didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: I these so much. These are giving penny loafer but an elevated version that speaks to current trends in sneakers.
review.name: I these so much

review.reviewBody: I have gotten so many compliments on these. I've worn them with and without socks. I bought the white and was a bit worried about potential outfits but they've looked great with everything. They look especially good with wide legged pants.Yes, they are a little bit heavy to walk in but not a deal breaker. I wore them out of the box for a couple of hours without any issues. The leather cleans easily as well. I find them to be comfortable and worth the cost.
review.name: Don't Hesitate

review.reviewBody: Very cute and comfy, love them and get lots of compliments
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful shoe.  I didn't expect the leather to be so beautiful.  I'm wearing a bandaid on the back of my heel -- but I think that's just me. They make all my wide legged pants look cool.
review.name: Beautiful leather upper

review.reviewBody: love ‘em!!! they are so cute and comfortable -- and they come with barrels of compliments. (i did end up getting 1/2 size bigger than usual because the toe bed is on the narrow side.)
review.name: Just what I wanted!!

name: Caribou X WP Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I really wanted these shoes to work because I love the purple color and they are so sleek looking.  However, they just didn't fit my feet. I have higher arches and the one Boa closure caused too much pressure on the top of my foot.  All of my other shoes have at least 2 buckles/boas which apparently distributes the pressure better on the top of my foot (rather than having only one adjustment for the entire lacing system).
review.name: Looks so good......

review.reviewBody: Great for the American foot size.  I had to have a wide size in other brands but was happily surprised that these fit so well with lots of toe wiggle room.  1st ride of 40+ miles without any issues or foot numbness.
review.name: amazing shoe

review.reviewBody: These pants are comfortable and the fabric has a nice feel, but these pants are more suited to an outdoor city adventure than climbing or hiking. I had the extreme displeasure of wearing them in the actual outdoors and stumbled across some pricker bushes, not many but enough. my pants around mid-calf have a lot of pulls and are basically unwearable except for evening excursions where it won't be seen. Highly disappointed for the price point.
review.name: Do not wear in the woods

review.reviewBody: I was pleasantly surprised by these pants! At 5'9, I often struggle to find pants that are long enough, but these were the perfect length. They're also incredibly comfortable whether I'm hiking or just lounging around. I appreciate the fit of these and love how versatile they are for any activity. Overall, these pants exceeded my expectations and have become a go-to in my wardrobe.
review.name: My new go to pants for the summer

review.reviewBody: They arrived on Tuesday before a 3 day trip 170 mile back country trip that started on Thursday.  They worked fantastically, for all day riding and huge hike-a-bikes.
review.name: Great bike packing shoes

review.reviewBody: Pretty comfortable but wished I had ordered on size up since it runs small.
review.name: Great shoes, order one size up

review.reviewBody: Had a previous version for flat pedals that I liked but were too heavy and not stiff enough. These are much lighter and fit more comfortably too, especially in the toe box where they're wider than others. I still had to go up to a 46 to accommodate my toes though, I normally wear a 45. The size chart from Specialized shows a 46 fits like a US 11 at 29.5 cm.
review.name: Love'em

review.reviewBody:
I am 6'1" and 200lbs, and typically wear a size 12.5US (Nike, Altra, Hoka). These fit snug with socks on the thin side --I prefer thicker socks normally. Having said that, they offer a pretty solid pedaling platform and walking on them thus far has not been bad at all.

They are definitely not geared to XC --but trail/enduro. And for that, for me, they are perfect!
review.name: Stiff uppers and sticky rubber...

review.reviewBody: I recently got these shoes and have used them on 4 rides ranging from 1-3 hrs.  I have a fairly wide foot and find these to be a really good fit.  My right foot felt a little pinched on the first ride and at the beginning of my last ride, but the leather provides a little stretch and is really comfortable.  I use these for trail riding and really like the power transfer.  I don't notice a difference coming from an old Sidi dominator 3.  They are really light as well and feel comfortable for walking.  The cleat does have a small amount of contact when walking, but it should be fine for quick trips to get coffee or beers.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody:
I?m a big fan of laces. I?ve had boas and ratchets over the years and keep coming back to lace ups. 

Stiff sole, decent venting, solid toe protection, and the fit of laces. 

Not the widest shoe out there so if you?ve got the need for a wide shoe, look elsewhere. 

Only downside is the break-in period. 
After 50 miles I started to notice them settling in.
review.name: Most(ly) excellent

review.reviewBody:
Specialized has produced the most uncomfortable mtb shoe on the planet.
I didn't think it was possible because I love my original set of specialized shoes.
review.name: So uncomfortable
comment: Are you talking about the narrow width? That was  why they didn?t work for me.
Hey Terry, any chance you can elaborate a bit more? What did you specifically not like about the shoe? What makes it uncomfortable to you?

name: 2FO Roost Clip Mountain Bike Shoe

review.reviewBody: These shorts run true to size. Overall I’ve been so happy and have bought multiple colors from last year and this year. I’m sad because I really like these shorts with the beautiful liner that is sewn in, but concerned about the quality for the long term. description: Buy the Mad Rock Super Tech Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Super Tech Quickdraw
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mad Rock Super Tech Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought a few of these a while back and end up selling them due to the poor ergonomics.  The springs on the gates are super stiff, so the clips are not smooth and you have to really push the rope in.  Maybe that softens up with more use, but I've never had to do that with any other carabiners, so poor design regardless.  The basket for the rope on the clipping end is also very shallow and nearly flat, so you have very little space between your finger and the gate for the rope to go in to when you clip.  I routinely would have the rope getting caught under the bottom of the gate due to my finger getting in the way when clipping, which is not good.  This does not happen with any other carabiners I have ever used, even tiny carabiners like Neutrinos, Nano 22s, and Trango phases.  Couple that with the price that is barely any cheaper (or even slightly more expensive) than many other far superior quickdraws, these are not worth the purchase.  Get Petzl Djinns or the BD HotForge hybrids for the same price and those are miles better than these.
review.name: Poor performance and handling
comment: Hey Bryan, I'm sorry these didn't work out for you. I will be reaching out via email shortly to try and remedy this.

name: Super Tech Quickdraw

review.itemreviewed: Emelie III Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really like the look of these shoes, and some simple, cute waterproof leather boots were exactly what I was looking for. Unfortunately I had a hard time sizing them - they were too floppy in my normal size, so I exchanged for a half size smaller but now they’re really tight in the toes and still loose in the heels. I’m hoping they’ll break in eventually, but the leather is really stiff. Maybe a better fit for someone with narrow feet.
review.name: Narrow toe
comment: Hello AshB, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our EMELIE™ III Women's Zip Bootie is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Emelie III Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am so happy with these boots! The color is beautiful and they are incredibly comfortable.  I was able to wear them with wool socks and they still had enough room (with my normal shoe size).  I tried them with ankle socks and they rubbed my skin too much at the top of boot so I opted for socks that went above or just to the top of boot.
review.name: Love these!

name: Emelie III Zip WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: This swallow a lot of gear, the load compresses well with the straps, and it has a sturdy zipper. The problem?  It is a WHEELED duffle but the  handle makes wheeling it impossible. The handle is so small that the thing bumps against the backs of your feet and legs unless you hold your arm way out to your side, which is a shoulder injury waiting to happen, not to mention completely awkward.  I would return this if I could, but I did not discover this problem until I began walking into the airport for an overseas trip.  It is the first time I have ever been unhappy with an Eagle Creek product - and I am EXTREMELY unhappy.
review.name: BEWARE:  MAJOR design flaw!

review.reviewBody: I bought this duffle for a trip where someone carried my bag, bag worked great when I didn’t have to roll it. No regrets on booking that trip but regrets on purchasing the duffle. My second trip using this bag the bag looks terrible.  The exterior of the bag hasn’t held up. It looks worse than my 10 year old Costco bag. Then take note If you actually want to roll the bag and you’re over 5’ tall you have to bend over because the bag will drag on the bottom otherwise. I originally thought something was wrong with me when I was rolling it and I had multiple people offer to help me because I was so awkwardly bent over. I finally said yes to help and they had to bend over awkwardly too to help roll it. This person commented on how terrible the design was…. Icing on the cake was when a second person made the same comment. I wish I could return it because it’s garbage.
review.name: Never write reviews

review.reviewBody:
I bought this before my trip to Mexico because I wanted a rolling 100L+ duffle bag. Upon getting to the airport, my friend complimented my new all-black duffle and said he wanted to get one too. This bag is easy to 
transport and highly functional. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
review.name: Well designed duffle that looks great

name: Migrate 110L Wheeled Duffel Bag

hasVariant.name: Coldfront Down Mitten
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Coldfront Down Mitten online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have always suffered from cold hands, and decided to try down. These have been toasty warm down to minus 25C so far. Amazing for the light weight. The trick is to keep the insulation uncompressed - don't grip anything, and don't wear these inside another layer. I wouldn't use them with ski poles for example. And in any case the shell is not toughened. But for keeping idle hands warm, these are ideal - far warmer than any mitts with synthetic insulation of similar thickness.
review.name: Very warm if kept lofted.

review.reviewBody: I purchased as a packable light weight glove for split-boarding. great for keeping the hands warm on breaks. Can be a little difficult to get on and off when hands are sweaty. If a bigger size was available it's possible that would have resolved this minor issue.
review.name: cozy and warm

review.reviewBody: This is a great addition to your existing winter mitts to help keep you warm.
review.name: Great addition

review.reviewBody: I have only used these mittens once so far, but they warmed up my already cold fingers in a few minutes. Great for backpacking or for packing an extra warm layer for you hands in case or emergency, as they are really light and compressible, yet feel very warm. I wouldn't use to grab onto things (poles during hiking/skiing or rocks during scrambling) as they don't seem very rough, but that's not what they are meant for anyway and you can layer under a goretex shell mitt.
review.name: Light and warm

review.reviewBody: I am 5'2 and the XS was perfect and had space for my hand to move around. I LOVE them - the color is so vibrant, and I love that they clip together so they can't get lost.
review.name: Warm and cozy!

review.reviewBody: Warm, well made, nice fit
review.name: Good mitts

review.reviewBody: I have only wore these a few times while walking my dogs but they are definitely warm. I actually took them off a few times because my hands were almost too warm. Tested them out on a 25 degree morning.
review.name: Very warm mittens.

review.reviewBody: I freaking love these. They saved my fingers on a cold backcountry day. I don’t see them being an all-the-time glove, but perfect to have in your pack.
review.name: Saved the day

review.reviewBody: I bought these along with the Commuter gloves for my outdoor winter photography. The gloves were for working with the camera, and these Mitts were to slip into if my hands got chilled. They are wonderfully warm, fit well (I use XL for all my OR gloves and mitts), and compress to nothing so they take up minimal space in my pack.
review.name: Great lightweight warmth in a small package size

review.reviewBody: I recently moved to Montana and have chronically cold hands. These down mitts keep my fingers toasty even in single digit temps.
review.name: My hands are finally warm on freezing dog walks!

name: Coldfront Down Mitten

review.reviewBody: Just installed this tape. Took about four tries to arrive to the endpoint with enough tape. They are very stingy with the amount of tape they give you. Especially for what it costs. The overlap is nowhere near the half width they show in the installation video on the lizard skin site. And forget about the figure 8 that they recommend around the brake levers. There's never gonna be enough for that. Aside from that I like the look and feel of the grip. Took it out for a ride and it's very secure in hand. Feels safe from slippage.
review.name: Stingy length

review.reviewBody: I love this new tape. I bought it in Celeste Green to use on my black road bike. Wrapped well. Advertised as stretchy, but the instructions were clear: NOT to stretch. I did wrap with steady, strong tension and got a great look and tight tape. The color really pops in a good way. It has a nice sticky texture and is a pleasure to ride. It has stayed clean. I can't comment on durability yet, but based on the feel, plus reviews and reputation make me think I will enjoy this for a long time.
review.name: Good looking, great performing tape!

review.reviewBody:
I’ll start with the positives, of which there are quite a few.  The tape is VERY grippy, which is a good thing.  This is by far the tackiest bar tape I’ve used, which gives me supreme confidence descending, even if my hands are sweaty.  The cushion level is also great - still thin enough to avoid the bars from feeling massive, but it absolutely absorbs road buzz.  The colors are also fantastic - you’re sure to have something that matches or compliments your frame.  But that leads into one of the negatives…

There are a couple of challenges, though, one of which being the difficulty of installation.  It isn’t the hardest tape in the world to wrap, but it is far from the easiest.  Maintaining enough tension to keep a tight wrap without stretching is a pain the the rear, especially around the hoods.  To be fair, if this was the only issue I would still give this at least a four, if not a five star rating because a challenging installation is worth it if the product is awesome.

Appearance is the other issue, which I hinted at above.  I have the sky blue.  It looks dynamite on my bike, but has been irreversibly stained after ONE RIDE.  Quite literally one ride and the bar tape is already discolored from the places my hands were on the bars.  I’ve tried soapy water and isopropyl alcohol, but nothing doing.  

This is a super premium priced product, and to have it permanently discolored after one ride is really disappointing.  Perhaps a darker color would not be an issue, so take this complaint with a grain of salt.
review.name: Tough to Install, Tougher to Keep Clean

review.reviewBody: This tape doesn't come with enough to wrap my entire bars which are particularly wide (50cm Cowchipper). I like the feel of this tape and it provides a good amount fo cushion, but if you have a wide ATB/gravel bar you likely won't have enough tape to get to the tapered section in the middle. That was frustrating and had me ready to give 2 stars. It earned an extra star due to a screw-in bar plug.
review.name: Great tape...but not for wide bars.

review.reviewBody: I got caught in the rain while on a ride with this tape. Normally, this shouldn't be an issue, but it destroyed the adhesive on the back of the tape. I let it dry out and tired to reapply it to my bars, but the "oh so great" Dura Soft Polymer does not stretch at all. No way to put tension in the tape = loose bar tape. Plus, the tape started to get discolored from my gloves after a single ride. For $40, I expected better than this garbage. I would give this tape 0 stars if possible. Save yourself some money and buy stretchy, non-adhesive tape (e.g., Bontrager Gel Cork). All that said, I was very pleased with Competitive Cyclist's customer service -- I got a free return label and a prompt refund.
review.name: Terrible Product, Great Customer Service

review.reviewBody: It's great bar tape. It's grippy and highly visible and very comfortable.
review.name: Love This Tape

review.reviewBody: This is my preference of tape, its super grippy and comfortable.
review.name: Grippy Tape

review.reviewBody: Quality. Thicker tape which makes it comfy. Small grip to it as well. Worth it.
review.name: Comfy Grip Tape

review.reviewBody: Not much to say here. Very grippy tape
review.name: Quality tape

name: DSP 2.5mm Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: This is my first backpack for backpacking and thru-hiking. This is a very versitale pack and fairly light weight as well.
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody: I really do like all the space and pockets but the fit is just a little awkward at some times but still one of my top packs.
The pack is sturdy and well built. It functions well when there is minimal load but the chest strap has a tendency to ride up when the load is more than 30lbs.
review.name: Paragon for quick movements

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack before I became a member of Expert Voice and I thought I got a good deal on it before seeing the price here! I did a ridiculous amount of research on packs for my upcoming Appalachian Trail thru-hike, ultimately settling on this one. Since it’s the dead of winter, I haven’t taken it out for a shakeout hike yet, but I’ve put all of my gear, including a bear canister, in it and everything fits easily. 

The pack is too heavy to be considered an ultralight, but it feels incredibly stable and secure for its light weight. I’ve worn it to go up and down the stairs from the basement to the second floor for about twenty minutes of work and it is perfectly comfortable. Can’t wait to try it out on the trail this spring!
review.name: Perfect for me

review.reviewBody: Bought this after trying on most packs in this volume range from Gregory, Osprey, and Deuter. I use a frameless UL pack for summer backpacking in the Appalachians, and got the Paragon 58 to replace my winter pack. Used it several times now with 25-35 lb loadouts and I love it! It swallows a ton of bulky gear and the frame and suspension system keep it comfy. Looking forward to many more miles.
review.name: Great High Volume Bag

review.reviewBody:
Lightweight, good capacity, comfortable support system.  Will meet most light backpacking 
needs.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: I've had a Paragon 58 for a couple of years now, and after regular use I can confidently recommend this pack. It's laid out intuitively with lots of helpful straps and loops to fix things to the outside of it, it's comfortable for longer hikes, and it hasn't needed any repairs or fixes after regular year-round use.
review.name: Stands the test of time

review.reviewBody: It was able to carry the load and then some. Well made. It was recommended to me from an avid hiker and outdoorsmans. The pocket for reaching my water bottle without dismount was a plus. A great buy.
Adjusts in so many ways to make it the most accommodating pack I own.

Excellent features, used on an overnight so far, with minimal base weight but was easy to pack and comfortable even over rougher steeper terrain. The support was excellent and the side load with helpful to get to things. Probably solid for anyone who wants a very solid pack at a reasonable price, a good pack for anyone. Look at your base weight when picking a pack!
review.name: Great backpacking pack

name: Paragon 58L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I have the Rab Incline pants which fit me well. I bought a pair of these Incline Light pants for warmer climates but they are a completely different fit. They fit a size smaller than the regular Incline Pants plus the leg is narrower. A size up will probably still be too narrow in the leg also. Disappointed - returned them.
review.name: Not a good fit

review.reviewBody:
I purchased 2 pairs of Incline pants size 12 and returned one pair as they were extremely oversized. I kept one pair which was a better fit but still very oversized with a fit completely different from the model photos 
The size chart has no relevance to the actual garment so it makes it rather difficult to know which size to buy.
review.name: I purchased 2 pairs of

review.reviewBody: love these pants, so comfy to wear and perfect for walking in
review.name: love these pants, so comfy

review.reviewBody: I did not expect an extra small to be this baggy on me. It fits like a size 4, which is a very relaxed look on me. There is plenty of room for a person with bulky thighs. Also, the inseam is so high in the back that it awkwardly stilts above the smallest point of my waist. I bought this for a thigh zip pocket accessible during climbing. The pocket is large enough for my phone, but the angle of the zipper is inconvenient with a harness. The fabric seems nice. I don't think I'll buy Rab again if their smallest size is this large.
review.name: First impression, baggy

review.reviewBody: These trousers are great, I love the yellow. As the name suggests, they are very lightweight.
review.name: These trousers are great, I

review.reviewBody: The lightweight material these pants are made is a hiker's dream!  I am so sad the cut of the pants does not work for me.  To begin with, I was looking for a slim fit pant and while the pant legs on the models look very slim, in reality they are quite a bit baggier.  What truly made me decide to return these pants though was the droopy crotch.  Extra material rubbing between your legs on a long hike is the last thing anyone needs.  If they just redesigned the cut to be more how they appear on the models they would be amazing backcountry pants.
review.name: Droopy Crotch

review.reviewBody: They are light and comfortable to wear. I use them for walking and hiking.
review.name: They are light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants for an upcoming walking holiday so haven’t worn them yet. I like the light fabric and loose ish fit in the leg which then tapers down to the ankle. They were very comfortable too when I tried them on. Looking forward to wearing them when I go away.

review.reviewBody:
The perfect inter-seasonal garment. This is so light, but somehow manages to generate a subtle warmth that functions over a range of temperatures. 
It packs away to almost nothing too. The styling is on point - it’s set apart from the typical range of hiking brands in a sleek understated manner. The soft inner and outer shell adds to the overall comfort. I own a few pieces by Fjallraven and this is my fave along with the Greenland jacket.
review.name: Perfect gilet

review.reviewBody: Wanted a vest I could wear under my rain jacket. I’m 5’9”, 160 lbs, 32” waist and athletic build. Originally ordered a medium but it was much too baggy. Exchanged for a small and it fits perfectly over a long sleeve shirt. The small is form fitting and hangs just below the belt. When moving around and going from sitting to standing it does ride up above my belt which is fine as I tuck in my shirts and carry a knife or multi tool on my belt. The vest is warm and comfortable wearing around the house and under other jackets on cold days.
review.name: Comfortable, warm and functional

review.reviewBody: This G-LOFT filled vest is my mid-layer in the winter, and also in my hiking pack during the summer. The synthetic-filling warms almost as good a down, but is much more pack-able. Heckin' useful!
review.name: Super-synthetic!

review.reviewBody: I am not usually a vest guy but this vest has won me over. I run pretty hot normally so I didn't want anything too bulky or heavy and this vest fits the bill. Being on the coast and i work hard I definitely did not want the down fill. The synthetic insulation is super warm and not too heavy, it also handles water great and doesn't lose its warmth when wet.
review.name: A versatile piece

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Abisko Padded Vest, and I can't say enough about it. Fjallraven is the only brand for me, because of it's stylish European designs, quality and commitment to the ethical treatment of animals and the environment. I would never buy from other makers of outerwear (especially those who use cruel methods of procuring down feathers - which is almost every other brand). Thanks Fjallraven!
review.name: Great buy

name: Abisko Padded Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Fantastic for cold morning runs or chilly walks with the dog. 
I did size up to a medium- probably could have stayed small but I like the extra room for layers if needed and I like longer sleeves to tuck my hands into. More well endowed women would definitely need to size up. 😃
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: Thinner layer than expected but would be perfect underneath something or on a mild weather day. Doesn’t have puffy all the way around. I was looking for something thicker as a main winter puffy so I returned it.
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: I have purchased two of these jackets because it’s perfect for travel. It can be packed into small places and it washes well. I wear mine for hiking and I love the snug fit which keeps cold air from flowing in from the bottom. The pockets are large enough to accommodate my phone, gloves, chapstick, bear spray, etc. There are also two unzippered pockets on the inside. I also love the length…not too short and not too long. For size reference I am 5’ 4.5”, 99 lbs, and XS fits perfectly, even with a polar tech 1/4 zip top underneath (but I am not busty at all).
review.name: Love This Jacket

review.reviewBody: This Jacket Looks Beautiful.my height is 4’11”.my weight is 117LbS.At the VERY Lowest part of the hip,at the very beginning of the zipper,the zip DiD NOT CLOSE.-my hips are a LittLe wider than the very bottom of the jacket,but not my much.it seemed Like if I could have gotten past my hips it would fit FiNE.This is size extra small.The extra small is not designed for a full hipped individual.I have a 25in waist.BACKCOUNTRY is an AMAZINGLY PHENOMENAL company.I’m certain to find something to purchase/buy through BACKCOUNTRY.Somebody very helpful told me that the “slim fit”in RAB is not designed well for women with curves but the”regular fit”in RAB does.I wish every review would publish height,weight and size they purchased.
review.name: Beautiful Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my second purchase of this Jacket and I still love it to bits as much as the first one.
review.name: This is my second purchase

review.reviewBody: Brilliant jacket, warm and light weight . Can be worn for anything very versatile. Can’t recommend enough
review.name: Brilliant jacket, warm and light

review.reviewBody: Had high hopes, given the price and brand name but returning it as it didnt like it would keep me warm enough.  Cannot be a standalone jacket for San Francisco weather of avg 15 deg Celsius. Maybe good as a layer but wasnt why I bought it. Also ordered XS looking at the size chart (my chest 32C) but felt a bit tight on shoulders and sleeves length was short. S would have been better
review.name: Good as one of the layers; not impressed

review.reviewBody: Pleased with the fit and comfort . I thought that I had read that it could fold into a pocket? Are there instructions for this because I can’t work it out !
review.name: Pleased with the fit and

review.reviewBody: Love it - received lots of compliments on the colour (citadel). It is so light but really warm, eminently packable and will be perfect for my trip to Canada in a few weeks time.
review.name: Love it - received lots

review.reviewBody: Great fit. As summer moves to winter on the South Island in NZ the wind from the pole is very cold and I haven’t found it quite warm enough to withstand the southerly blasts!
review.name: Great fit. As summer moves
